modules.description: Provides a function to extract a timestamp from a binary stream using a parser. Works with binary data represented as a byte stream and a parser state. Used to parse and retrieve time values from network protocol data or log files.

Encodes and formats structured data into human-readable strings using custom pretty-printing logic. It operates on a specific type `t` that represents encoded values, supporting field-specific formatting. The module enables precise control over how data is displayed in logs and debugging outputs.

Handles SMTP protocol operations such as connecting, sending EHLO, MAIL, RCPT, DATA, and QUIT commands. Works with socket connections, email headers, and message bodies to construct and transmit email data. Used to build custom SMTP clients or servers with TLS support and asynchronous capabilities.

Extracts timestamps from binary streams using parser state and formats structured data into readable strings with custom pretty-printing. It handles byte-level parsing for time values and supports detailed formatting of internal data types. Users can parse network protocol data and generate debug-friendly representations of encoded values. Examples include extracting timestamps from log files and customizing the display of serialized data.
